author: Rick Spilman
content:
“Think they are sailing?” With 68,000 square feet of canvas, the ship will move primarily by sail with generators running to keep the drinks cold. And yes, the generators can also drive the electric motors to turn the propellers.

I sailed on the Star Flyer, the four-masted barquentine, many years ago and she sailed beautifully. Her square sails are set and furled by hydraulic motors in the yards like the Royal Clipper and the Flying Clipper.

author: Chris Roche
content: Short on Ratlins so no running up aloft an over preponderance of deck houses will cause no end of windage, just think of what happened to the 7 mast schooner Thomas Lawson bet she has got large engines if anything like Royal Clipper but will suit those who can afford to sail in her and sit and drink cocktails and think they are sailing.
